meanings.definition: Make (someone or something) seem less impressive or important.
meanings.sent1: She belittled his efforts to fix the broken toy.
meanings.sent2: The teacher belittled the student's answer in front of the class.
meanings.sent3: He belittled the size of the cake, but ended up eating the most.
meanings.sent4: Her achievements were often belittled by her jealous colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The storm belittled the once towering trees into mere twigs.

meanings.sent1: He belittled her taste in music, calling it outdated.
meanings.sent2: The critic belittled the movie, claiming it lacked originality.
meanings.sent3: She belittled his cooking skills, but then asked for seconds.
meanings.sent4: The coach belittled the team's efforts, motivating them to work harder.
meanings.sent5: His words belittled her confidence, but she stood tall and proved him wrong.
